ygData.subject: Re: A few things--thanks
ygData.msgSnippet: You ll find this is not a strength bonus but instead your skill with the desired weapon... If a player uses a weapon that is above his skill you wont hit for
ygData.messageBody:
You'll find this is not a strength bonus but instead your skill with the
desired weapon...

If a player uses a weapon that is "above" his skill you wont hit for the
maximum damage.... For instance at level 9 with a FS 2handed I did 18
damage, as soon as I got to level 10 Damage jumped to the 25 max for the
weapon. So from this I think your level is too low for such a high magic
weapon.... I bet when you hit level 20 you will get the full damage from the
weapon....

Cubious
High-Elf Paladin



-----Original Message-----
From: Rodney Miller [SMTP:RMiller@...]
Sent: 27 May 1999 14:15
To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] A few things--thanks

From: Rodney Miller <RMiller@...>

Thanks Michael for the info. I have a couple of questions
concerning the
strength bonus to attack and the double attack. I am about to go to
18th
level as a Paladin on Innoruuk and have a shiny brass halberd as
well. The
most I hit for with it so far is 29 damage. I know I get double
attack at
19th but I have seen guys hitting with the halberd for about 34
damage and I
assume it is from the strength bonus. At what level does the
strength bonus
kick in for attack? I have 95 native strength. What is the formula
for
figuring your max damage with the halberd? Thanks for all your
information
and look forward to hearing from you.

Grod
